lead_paragraph: Brendan Hansen broke his own world record in the 100-meter breaststroke last night at the United States Summer National Swimming Championships in Irvine, Calif. Hansen won with a time of 59.13 seconds, eclipsing the mark of 59.30 that he set at the 2004 United States Olympic trials.
